meanings.definition: Having a greater distance between two opposite sides.
meanings.sent1: The blanket was thicker than the sheet.
meanings.sent2: The tree trunk was thicker than the branch.
meanings.sent3: The fog grew thicker as the night went on.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was thicker than peanut butter.
meanings.sent5: The plot thickened as the detective uncovered more clues.

meanings.definition: More dense or substantial in consistency.
meanings.sent1: The soup was thicker after adding more flour.
meanings.sent2: The mud was thicker after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The suspense in the movie was thicker than oatmeal.
meanings.sent4: The air was thicker with humidity in the tropical forest.
meanings.sent5: The plot thickened like a stew simmering on the stove.

meanings.definition: More intense or extreme in a particular quality or characteristic.
meanings.sent1: The tension in the room grew thicker as the argument escalated.
meanings.sent2: The drama in the play became thicker in the final act.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the air was thicker than a fog.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the library was thicker than molasses.
meanings.sent5: The mystery surrounding the old house thickened like a sauce on the stove.
